element.name: Dark Side of the Hill by albertw, Traditional Cache (3.5/3.5)
element.description: A microcache hidden in the depths of Killiney hill. This is a tricky micro hidden in a tricky part of the forest. The road less travelled so to speak. Please bring your own pen!

img.p: This park is best known for its quarries, green fields, forest paths, telegraph tower and obelisk. But that is only half the hill. Another large portion is covered by impenetrable gorse bushes which have frustrated a couple of would be caches on the hill (and destroyed one)! However on the southern side of Killiney hill there is quite a dense deciduous forest. There are a couple of walked paths through it but that’s about it, people mainly stick to the main park and leave this area undisturbed. The smaller paths are just animal trails. With a lot of patience there are foxes, rabbits, badgers and squirrels to be seen in this forest.

You can get a DART train to Dalkey station if you want to use public transport, alternatively there is parking on the hill at N 53° 16.158 W 6° 6.593. From here I suggest you make your way to N 53° 16.003 W 6° 6.538. From there you will see a path heading up over granite into the forest...
This path, and I use the word loosely, eventually ends at the far side of the hill...

Somewhere along this path there is a microcache. There are a lot of trees which will make GPS reception difficult. You may need to pause and double back on your track to try to get good GPS accuracy. But hey! It’s meant to be difficult!

This part of the forest should only be accessed by people who don’t mind an adventure and tricky forest paths. Boots are advised since it’s easy to sprain an ankle in just shoes if you are not careful.
I hope this is difficult enough cache for you!

element.encoded-hints: On the path, (and the GPS should put you on the path!) you know you are in the right area if you find a large fallen tree across most of the path, near it are some large granite boulders. Need more help? All the rocks around here should be granite.

ul.li:
2010-04-24T19:00:00Z : Found it by pplsgod
Found with Laura374 after a what seemed like an eternity One of those frustrating and then rewarding caches all in one TFTC - enjoyed it afterall

2010-04-24T19:00:00Z : Found it by Laura374
TFTC - Found with pplsgod
Great hiding place, found it hard to get too but got it in the end. Did end up a few scratches but it was well worth it. :)

2010-04-10T19:00:00Z : Found it by CJohnson2010
Yay found it second time on such a beautiful day! Well worth it, very clever!

2010-03-17T19:00:00Z : Found it by didi2206
My second time here.. brought help but ended up finding it myself in the end! Just need to be methodical!! Great hiding place. TN left a trolley token as it was empty of goodies [:(] TFTC

2009-10-18T19:00:00Z : Found it by CheekyCheetah
Found when out with my parents (Frezeluberz) TFTC

wpt.name: GCPX7G
wpt.desc: Dark Side of the Hill by albertw, Traditional Cache (3.5/3.5)
